question_text: What are common monitor problems and how do you distinguish them from graphics card issues?
answer_options: Monitor problems only affect brightness and have no other symptoms
Dead pixels, backlight failure, power issues - test with different source to isolate from graphics card
All monitor problems automatically indicate graphics card failure
Monitor problems only occur during specific software applications
correct_answer: Dead pixels, backlight failure, power issues - test with different source to isolate from graphics card
explanation: Monitor problems include: dead pixels, backlight failure, power issues, button malfunctions, and physical damage. Distinguish from graphics card issues by: testing monitor with different source (laptop, phone), checking for problems across all inputs, verifying power LED status, and testing known good monitor with suspect system.
